name: places/ChIJ-Zj7LhhZwokRoPagYRaHHkY
adrFormatAddress: 1165 Broadway, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text:
What stands out at this Joe and the Juice is the friendly service - especially for NYC (smile). The place is clean with hip but chill music. The food and drinks are consistent with what you'll find at the other branches. Good place to have a beverage and get some work done.

The neighborhood can be a bit iffy at times, but not their fault.

originalText.text: Despite paying $1.3 for extra Jalapeno, I found fewer than 5 small pieces in my sandwich, and their taste was barely noticeable. Hoping for improved consistency when customers pay for extras.

text.text: Despite paying $1.3 for extra Jalapeno, I found fewer than 5 small pieces in my sandwich, and their taste was barely noticeable. Hoping for improved consistency when customers pay for extras.

originalText.text: Slowest service. It took over 20 minutes to get a smoothie. When i got it i took one sip and had to throw it away it was disgusting. Not blended at all and just a bunch of dates sucked up through the straw. The chunkiest nastiest thing I’ve ever had the consistency can only be described as “vomit-like” but i didn’t have time to go ask for a refund because i waited so long to get it i was going to be late for my meeting.

originalText.text: I was in from Texas with a group of friends,  a total of 8 of us on Sun. 12/10 and one of our friends had been taking about this place so we decided to try it out. Of course we all ordered separately and I happened to be the 1st to order one Avocado club and carrot cake, that's it. The rest of my group ordered and they all got there orders before me which I decided to go ask "Moody Vinny" and all she asked with an attitude as if it was my fault was "You didn't get your food" and said no I haven't received my food, Vinny rolls her eyes and turns her back ok me and starts talking to another employee asking why she didn't make the club, Vinny made my club and continued with a terrible attitude throughout the process of club,  yells my name and not once did she choose to apologize for the error. I pick up my food, then Vinny chooses to talk among her Co workers while staring at our table, again,  as if it was my fault that they made a mistake. Then to top it off, one of the male staff members kept making gagging noises. So unprofessional & disgusting to be doing that in a food establishment while customers are dining in. Vinny is very very rude & unprofessional. The club was actually really good but I at least don't recommend the Broadway location due to rudeness to customers.

originalText.text:
I think I was disappointed for the last time here. I won’t be back to give them another try.   It’s consistently bad service and I never get the feeling they want to be there or want me to come back.  I paid 14$ for a few pieces of strawberry, 1/4 of a banana, some ice, a splash of oat milk and almost a full scoop of protein powder, it tasted pretty nasty but I didn’t want to go through it with them to get a refund.
I guess they get paid enough to show up but maybe offering a bonus if they act like they want to be there or act like the person in front of them matters would help.  Or maybe the business model is Run-it-into-the-ground that seems to be popular these days.
